identificationModule.briefTitle: Patient Journey in Hospital With Heart Failure in Turkish Population
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicentre, Prospective, Observational, Hospital-based Registry of Patients With Acute Heart Failure Those Whose Care Was Guided by a Cardiologist in Turkey

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to compose a national database of the etiologies, clinical and demographic characteristics, using diagnostic tests, precipitating and risk factors, management of from intensive care unit or coronary care unit to hospital discharge, length of stay in the intensive care unit and hospital, in-hospital mortality and discharge medications of hospitalized acute heart failure patients in Turkish population.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The etiologies, precipitating factors, demographics, clinical characteristics, management and outcome of patients admitted in hospital with acute heart failure in Turkish population will be recorded.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Adherence to European Heart Failure Guideline
primaryOutcomes.description: To assess number of patients managed and treated following the last European Heart Failure Guidelines

secondaryOutcomes.description: Length of stay in hospital in Turkish population admitted to study

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients \>18 years olds
* Clinical diagnosis of acute heart failure
* Admitted to the participating hospitals

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients \<18 years old
* Patients with acute heart failure who are discharged from the emergency room without admission.
* Failure to obtain informed consent
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Hospitalized patients with acute heart failure

overallOfficials.name: Ahmet Ekmekçi, MD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Dr. Siyami Ersek Göğüs Kalp Ve Damar Cerrahisi Eğitim Ve Araştırma Hastanesi

groups.title: JourneyHF-TR
groups.description: The patients who were hospitalized with the diagnosis of acute heart failure in intensive/coronary care units between September 2015 and 2016 were included in our study.

eventGroups.title: Hospitalized Patients With Acute Heart Failure
eventGroups.description: The Journey HF-TR study is a cross-sectional, multicenter, non-invasive and observational trial that was conducted in intensive/coronary care units and cardiology wards. The patients who were hospitalized with the diagnosis of acute heart failure in intensive/coronary care units between September 2015 and 2016 were included in our study.
